abstract: The state’s lawsuit suggests that certain 24-count packages of Motrin had defects, as well as those containing eight-count vials.
snippet: The state’s lawsuit suggests that certain 24-count packages of Motrin had defects, as well as those containing eight-count vials.
lead_paragraph: An effort by Johnson & Johnson to buy back defective Motrin pills from store shelves  described as a “phantom recall” by some members of Congress  has come under fire in a lawsuit filed by the state of Oregon against the company.

headline.main: Oregon Sues J.&J. in Motrin Buyback
headline.print_headline: Oregon Sues J.&J. In Motrin Buyback

byline.original: By Natasha Singer and Reed Abelson
